document_data.name: Harlyr
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2007)/06-03 - Perfumes and Scents}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Harlyr''' ({{Pronounce|har|LEER|refs=}}) was the cheapest and the most common [[perfume]] found on the streets of [[Waterdeep]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Harlyr was a clear, slightly [[oil]]y red liquid that had no smell unless applied to bare skin. On most [[humanoids]]'s skin, harlyr was absorbed and exuded a pleasant aroma of freshly bloomed [[rose]]s for about three hours. When it was applied to the skin of [[half-orc]]s, [[orc]]s, [[goblin]]s, and [[hobgoblin]]s, harlyr turned black and released stench of charred [[goldflow]].
document_data.Preparation: The recipe for harlyr was commonly and correctly known as using [[nut]] oil, [[alcohol]], and the sap of three types of common [[wildflower]]s.
